Utica.Whitesboro, New York: Whitesboro (called Che-ga-quat-ka by the Haudenosaunee) is a village in Oneida County, New York, United States. The population was 3,772 at the 2010 census. The village was named after Hugh White, an early settler who had been adopted into the Oneida tribe and built the first permanent settlement there in 1784-85.
